definition: to warm up/to heat up/hot (of weather)/heat/fervent

sentences.english: And I’ve stifled in the muggy air of Hefei in Anhui.
sentences.chinese: 亦曾在安徽合肥的闷热天气中气喘如牛。

sentences.english: They are waiting for their lunch in some steamy haus.
sentences.chinese: 他们在一间潮湿闷热的房间里等着吃午饭。

sentences.english: The long time is a darkness moist sultry cavern likely.
sentences.chinese: 冗长的光阴像是一条阴晦湿润的闷热洞穴。

sentences.english: Djakarta was a collection of sweltering huts and hovels.
sentences.chinese: 雅加达实际不过是一大堆闷热的棚户和茅舍。

sentences.english: Other-worldly chanting, to the rhythm of the rising and falling picks resonated through the hot, still air.
sentences.chinese: 闷热的空气里回荡着圣歌的旋律和镐斧起落的声音。

sentences.english: The electric fan blades whirled in the hot room.
sentences.chinese: 电扇的桨叶在闷热的房内旋转著。

sentences.english: The close weather will last for some time.
sentences.chinese: 这种闷热的天气将持续一段时间。

sentences.english: Even in the sweltering heat, the milestones keep coming.
sentences.chinese: 尽管闷热难当，我们已经跑过了一连串的里程碑。

sentences.english: "Besame Mucho" and "Dancing in the Dark" are sultry romances wafted on light Latin beats.
sentences.chinese: “和”黑暗中的舞蹈“拉丁节奏的轻飘荡闷热的恋情。
这是个漆黑闷热的夜晚。

sentences.english: How long will the shirt-sleeve weather last?
sentences.chinese: 这样闷热的天气会持续多久呢？

sentences.english: It was a muggy morning in august.
sentences.chinese: 这是八月里一个闷热的早晨。

sentences.english: Meat will readily taint in close weather.
In scorching summer it's very sultry.
It had been a close, rainy day in October.
sentences.chinese: 那是十月的一个闷热的阴雨天。

sentences.english: She fanned herself with a newspaper in the hot, stuffy room.
sentences.chinese: 在这闷热的房间里，她用报纸搧风。

definition: to trend/to get popular quickly/sudden heat wave (weather)
to feel oppressed/to be depressed/to feel dejected
early autumn/7th month of the lunar calendar
